response.message:
Love being able to favorite a question now. It allows me to distinguish between a good question and just a question (even a bad one) that's interesting enough for me to save/monitor.

However, FWIW, I had already gotten used to the idea of just voting up a question (even bad ones) that I thought were interesting enough to save/monitor.

I thought the intention of “Favorites” wasn't yet another counter but just a way of tracking threads. 

Sometimes you'll throw votes an up vote and not want to check out the thread again, other times you'll want to see how something goes without voting.

I'm not complaining about how it is implemented but I guess that's what I assumed the difference was.
Now I just can't wait to see what the preferences tab will become.

I was using the upvotes as a way of tracking 'favourites' but found it to be problematic, as you can only see recent upvotes from your profile page.

Is there a way to see all your up and down votes on SO?

Also, where is the most appropriate place to ask questions like this? You don't want them on SO, but Uservoice doesn't seem entirely appropriate either.

Keep up the fantastic work!

Favourites is very useful on Joel's BOS forum. I am sure it will be useful on SO.

Thanks!
Is there a way to sort by favorite; to see the entries most marked as favorite by all users?
